{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3559685,"name":"Sam Bowling","username":"SBowling4","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/258eb7/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-17T20:10:39.223Z","cooked":"

I made a post a week ago about our wrist having PID issues, which we did get figured out, but we’ve since moved on to a more serious, albeit less frequent, issue the other axis has.

Every few matches, we would completely lose control of it and it would flip back and forth at extremely fast, (as seen here at 45 seconds) and the only way to make it act as it should again is to reboot the code.

Nothing is coming unplugged, and the only idea that I had as to what is causing this is Command Scheduler loop overruns, which we get frequently.

What could be causing this, and how could we fix it?

Github

why do you have different controllers for increasing and decreasing?
what encoder are you using?
did your drive team intervene somehow to stop the oscillations in the video?

What encoder are you guys using? If your wrist moves slightly it may be trying to flash from 0 to 360 nearly instantly which may not be good. Try applying an acceleration cap to your output in which the wrist just wont move if its trying to move faster than the maximum acceleration. Another thing you can do is check your functions and commands. Since it didn’t happen at the start of the match, some command could be causing to move that way. You got this.

It’s a rev through bore encoder, we use two because the intake is not symmetrical and has very different weight profiles when moving between positions.

No, it just broke itself.

Are you using an absolute or a relative encoder? My team had issues with our elevator where it’d go crazy because it thought it was at a certain rotation when it wasn’t while we were using a relative encoder. the best way to fix this is to just physically set whatever you have the encoder on to zero before starting the match, or just using an absolute encoder.

It’s absolute. Also, I have more details: It seems more like the entire robot is breaking down. Nothing works right, it’s just the wrist was breaking itself, so we didn’t get a chance to see anything else. We reboot the code and it’s back to normal.
